thoughts.text: The 'browse_website' command returned information about the new features in Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye). We can now try to use the 'execute_shell' command to check the version of Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye) that we are currently running.
thoughts.reasoning: Now that we know more about the new features in Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye), it would be useful to check the version of the operating system that we are currently running. We can do this by using the 'execute_shell' command to run a shell command that will display the version of Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye) that we are currently running.
thoughts.plan: - Use the 'execute_shell' command with the argument 'cat /etc/debian_version' to check the version of Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye) that we are currently running.
thoughts.criticism: I should make sure that the shell command that we use is correct and will display the version of Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye) that we are currently running.
thoughts.speak: We can now try to use the 'execute_shell' command to check the version of Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye) that we are currently running.
